New Records: India won the T20 World Cup with an unbeaten campaign, the first since Australia in 2007.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Series with 15 wickets.
Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen scored 52 off 27 balls for South Africa.
Hardik Pandya took 3 wickets for 20 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 18 runs.
India won by 7 runs, defending 30 runs off the last 30 balls.
Suryakumar Yadav took a sensational catch to dismiss David Miller.
Hardik Pandya bowled the final over, taking crucial wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of team effort and high-pressure game experience.
Rahul Dravid discussed India's planning and preparations for the T20 World Cup.
Morkel highlighted the significance of South Africa reaching the T20 World Cup final.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience and called it his greatest achievement.
Rohit Sharma announced his retirement from T20Is.
Aiden Markram reflected on South Africa's campaign and expressed pride despite the loss.
Virat Kohli announced this was his last T20 World Cup and expressed gratitude for the win.
Jasprit Bumrah expressed joy and pride in his performance and the team's victory.
Hardik Pandya shared his emotional journey and pride in the team's achievement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados.
The final was affected by rain towards the end.
India's bowlers, Arshdeep Singh, Bumrah, and Pandya, were crucial in the final overs, conceding just 58 runs and taking 7 wickets in 10 overs.
